page.title: 02EMI FILM STUDIOS
page.content: EMI stands for Electrical Mechanical Industries and is owned by the Henson Organisation. This{film studio}was rebuilt in 1936 after a fire, and is now one of the few studios in the world with a ground stage. Three of the nine stages are used for {television}recordings. Stage 6 is the largest, being 210 feet long, whilst Stage 7, at 63 square feet, is the smallest. In order to make the film more realistic, large backcloths are hung on an overhead rail surrounding the stage.It usually takes two men two days to paint the huge cloth. EMI has it's own{special effects department on the site which covers 38 acres in total. As well as the 160 permanent staff there can be up to 600 temporary workers when a film is being shot. Films recorded here include Star Wars and Raiders of the Lost Ark.
